Articles.Content: Who else is going to have an all-female space program? Discuss!

Picture for anyone who has not seen:

![B-VN9oRIUAAjGE-.jpg:large](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/B-VN9oRIUAAjGE-.jpg:large)

I am not one bit surprised by how she looks; it is exactly as I expected.

I had half a mind to start an all-male space program for trolling's sake, but on second thought I don't care THAT much. I think I'll just let in female Kerbals with cool names the same way I do with the males ;P

Actually, in that light, did they mention whether they're updating the name generator to start making girl names? Presumably they should...
I... I can't say I particularly like it. The shape is nice, but the eyebrows look wonky and the hairline is weird. Well, better than nothin', and better late than never!
Wait, is that the official Valentina/female kerbal model?

> 
> Wait, is that the official Valentina/female kerbal model?

Yes it is. It was just revealed about 15 minutes ago on Squadcast!

I feel like we could have done without one or two details (eyelashes or ponytail? Hm...), but I'm actually really liking this design right at this moment! I might change my mind later, but they look nice and relatively agender. It kinda looks like they have thicker hair than the male kerbals, but I get so used to seeing the males I can't actually remember.

I shall enjoy smashing them into my launchpad and stranding them in space. Oh yes.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-21T19:04:52Z" title="02/21/2015 07:04  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 21, 2015</time> by Amihan**
  
i really did say eyebrows oops

She looks an awful lot like a kerbal version of my femshep from Mass Effect.

[![2013-05-07_00366.jpg](http://i307.photobucket.com/albums/nn302/Tork_Unib/2013-05-07_00366.jpg)](http://s307.photobucket.com/user/Tork_Unib/media/2013-05-07_00366.jpg.html)

I could not approve more.

Only complaint is the eyebrows/eyelashes/things that are above your world viewing ports look a little.. out of place.

Then again, I've never seen a kerbal with eyebrows, so it could just be that..

EDIT: In any case, i'll kind of miss all kerbals looking the same, kind of a different effect seeing exact clones panic as your ship plummets towards the ground..

Yeah, remove the eyebrows. The shape is fine. There's a nudging feeling telling me it's weird, but that's just me getting used to the old models ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> She looks an awful lot like a kerbal version of my femshep from Mass Effect.

Sorry, but my cactus has more of a resemblance with her than this. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If you think it's weird it might be because of the larger gap between her eyes than the males have.

![DAVoe4J.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/DAVoe4J.jpg)

> 
> If you think it's weird it might be because of the larger gap between her eyes than the males have.

Ah, that's why she seemed a bit "weird". Still, I really like the depiction and I feel we'll all get used to her over time.

I thought that too, and it is why \*that\* picture looks odd, but we're not looking head-on at her, so I think it might be an effect of the angle (the area between her eyes cuts off the left side of her right eyeball).
THAT'S it! Thanks for pointing that out. Now for some reason I feel better about it than I did.

> 
> I thought that too, and it is why \*that\* picture looks odd, but we're not looking head-on at her, so I think it might be an effect of the angle (the area between her eyes cuts off the left side of her right eyeball).

I considered that might be it, until I looked at the males at similar angles.
I like it. She looks fun and kind of crazy.

> 
> If you think it's weird it might be because of the larger gap between her eyes than the males have.
> [http://i.imgur.com/DAVoe4J.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/DAVoe4J.jpg)

I still say it's the eyelashes ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

![rqciaY8.png](http://i.imgur.com/rqciaY8.png)

Kerbals are simplistic, even something as small as those could add added complexity.

inb4 someone makes a mod that removes female Kerbals because they are sexist.

inb4 someone makes a mod that removes male Kerbals because they are feminist.

inb4 someone makes a mod that reverses all gender and Jeb, Bill, and Bob are girls and Valentina is a boy.

inb4 FlowerChild makes the next version of Better Than Starting Manned "Better Than Female Kerbals"

inb4 I squeal from female kerbal awesomeness. Valentina Hype!

- - - Updated - - -

The eyelashes are really important. The whole point of adding female kerbals is because existing Kerbals look male, so female Kerbals should look female. And the eyelashes+round head are the only good way to do it without lipstick, really long hair, or fat-filled mammary glands.
Oh you KNOW every chance Jeb, Bill and Bob and other Kerbals are going to hit on her every chance they got. poor girl is going to have a nervous breakdown...

I agree on the eyebrows, they're too... there. Onthe other hand, however, removing them outright makes her look even weirder. Maybe try simply loosening their presence somewhat? The hair is also weird, but I can't put my finger on it.

Ah well, other than that, she's pretty cute.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-21T02:35:10Z" title="02/21/2015 02:35  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 21, 2015</time> by Commissioner Tadpole**

The eyelashes look weird. The hair looks off too. I was hoping for something different on that aspect, but overall it's cool.

Edit: And the eyes, they need to be the same distance please.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-21T02:41:09Z" title="02/21/2015 02:41  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 21, 2015</time> by Robotengineer**
I actually like the eyelashes. They're one of the main things making her look awesome.
I actually really like her. Rounder face, basic eyelashes, and a no-nonsense, practical pony. Nice work ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

The eyelashes are important for adding some definition to her face, I think, since we've done away with the sharper jaws of male Kerbals. I do like the wider distance, personally. It adds a subtle softening and rounding to her features, making her more feminine, which is of course, the point.
